Description: Limestone kohl-pot with flat circular base and swelling vertical sides, which converge to a narrow mouth. Rim very roughly cut. Separate circular lid with projecting boss to fit neck of vessel. Both lid and vase decorated with incised motifs including a monkey, Taweret figure, jackal and Bes (?). Iconography very odd and might be faked
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995 Feb-May, Atlanta, Emory University, Reflections of Women in the New Kingdom
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
